content:
ISupportStarLayout Interface

Definition

Represents an element that controls the star layout.

In this Article

public interface ISupportStarLayout

Remarks

By default, the panels that lay out the ribbon use star sizing to show the largest possible control variation that can fit in the available space. Star sizing is a convention where the available space is divided evenly between the elements that need to occupy the space. The name derives from the fact that you specify star sizing by using an asterisk (*) in XAML.

Properties

IsStarLayoutPass

Gets a value that indicates whether the current layout pass is after the star layout pass.

public bool IsStarLayoutPass { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the current pass is a star layout pass; otherwise, false.

Methods

RegisterStarLayoutProvider(IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase)

Registers an element to participate in the star layout.

public void RegisterStarLayoutProvider (System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase starLayoutInfoProvider);
starLayoutInfoProvider
IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase

The element to register.

UnregisterStarLayoutProvider(IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase)

Removes an element from participation in the star layout.

public void UnregisterStarLayoutProvider (System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase starLayoutInfoProvider);
starLayoutInfoProvider
IProvideStarLayoutInfoBase

The element to remove.
